ch.usi.dag.disl

Class DiSL

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.usi.dag.disl.DiSL

  • public final class DiSL
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides an entry-point and a simple interface to the DiSL instrumentation framework. This interface is primarily used by the DiSL instrumentation server, but is generally intended for any instrumentation tool wishing to use DiSL.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Options for code transformations performed by DiSL.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiSL

        @Deprecated
public DiSL(boolean useDynamicBypass)
                 throws ch.usi.dag.disl.exception.DiSLException
        Deprecated. 
        Initializes a DiSL instance by loading transformers, exclusion lists, and DiSL classes.

        Note: This constructor is deprecated and will be removed in later releases. Use the init() static factory method to obtain a DiSL instance.

        Parameters:
        useDynamicBypass - determines whether to generate bypass code and whether to control the bypass dynamically.
        Throws:
        ch.usi.dag.disl.exception.DiSLException

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static DiSL init()
                 throws ch.usi.dag.disl.exception.DiSLException
        Creates a DiSL instance. This involves loading and parsing DiSL classes containing snippets, loading transformer classes, and setting up exclusion lists. This method uses the system properties to look for configuration settings.
        Returns:
        A DiSL instance.
        Throws:
        ch.usi.dag.disl.exception.DiSLException - if the initialization failed.

      • instrument

        public byte[] instrument(byte[] originalBytes)
                  throws ch.usi.dag.disl.exception.DiSLException
        Throws:
        ch.usi.dag.disl.exception.DiSLException

      • instrument

        public byte[] instrument(byte[] originalBytes,
                         int classloaderTag,
                         Reflection.Class[] supertypes)
                  throws ch.usi.dag.disl.exception.DiSLException
        Instruments the given class, provided as an array of bytes representing the contents of its class file.
        Parameters:
        originalBytes - the class to instrument as an array of bytes
        Returns:
        An array of bytes representing the instrumented class, or null if the class has not been instrumented.
        Throws:
        ch.usi.dag.disl.exception.DiSLException

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Termination handler - should be invoked by the instrumentation framework.
